snippet: As part of an effort to make health care pricing more transparent, the State Health Department released an online trove of hospitals’ median charges and costs for 1,400 conditions and procedures from 2009 to 2011.
abstract: New York State Health Department posts hospital cost data, naming hospitals and their median charges for 1,400 conditions and procedures from 2009 to 2011 in effort to make health care pricing more transparent; quick search through database for common procedures with same diagnosis code and level of severity turns up wild mix of startling bargains and enormous markups.
lead_paragraph: As part of an effort to make health care pricing more transparent, the State Health Department released an online trove of hospitals’ median charges and costs for 1,400 conditions and procedures from 2009 to 2011.

headline.main: New York State Hospital Data Exposes Big Markups, and Odd Bargains
headline.print_headline: State Hospital Cost Data Exposes Big Markups, and Odd Bargains
